drivers don't work like windows, they're still there - it's just whatever driver is being told to be used that gets used
so if it screws everything up because my card isnt supported properly is it possible to switch back 'easily'?

/etc/X11/xorg.conf is what usually defines what driver is in use. if X epically fails, you'll want to delete that file so it reverts to standard. because by installing ATI proprietary one of the steps will be forcing the driver in that config to the new one
so you could just log in at CLI and delete it
after backing up of course ;)
